image.altText: A man in a black suit and a yellow tie stands at a podium, addressing the press and gesturing to the crowd.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese is delivering the government's response to the Royal Commission into Defence and Veteran Suicide. Follow live.

title.children: Albanese responds to Royal Commission into veteran suicide

image.altText: Rooftop solar in Perth's southern suburbs

props.synopsis: With the rise and rise of rooftop solar showing no signs of stopping in Australia, the market operator says "emergency" powers to control it are urgently needed.

title.children: Market operator seeks emergency powers to switch off panels as solar tsunami 'threatens wipeout'

image.altText: Houses in Brisbane street

props.synopsis: National home prices are losing momentum, new data shows, and anticipated interest rate cuts are unlikely to stop falls in house prices next year.

title.children: 'A strain on households': Property market continues to lose steam and house price falls are expected for 2025

image.altText: A composite image of Kim Jong Un, Donald Trump and Elon Musk.

props.synopsis: When Donald Trump re-enters the White House on January 20, he will find that Kim Jong Un, the man he so enjoyed meeting, has built for himself a new international status – and is now a major ally of Vladimir Putin.

title.children: Trump has added another 'rocket man' to his friend list

image.altText: The Roblox app displayed on a smartphone screen with a Roblox logo in the background.

props.synopsis: Roblox is one of the most popular platforms in the world, but there are increasing concerns over the ability for users to message each other directly through games, with young children being lured off-platform and exposed to disturbing content.

title.children: 'Very naive': Mum's warning after her nine-year-old was targeted by a predator on Roblox

image.altText: Michael Rowland sits on the News Breakfast couch in studio

props.synopsis: Michael Rowland has announced he's leaving ABC News Breakfast after 15 years as co-host.

title.children: Michael Rowland leaves News Breakfast after 15 years but will stay at ABC

props.synopsis: As more cracks appear in the burgeoning super industry, performance won't take centre stage. The trust gap will.

title.children: New battleground starting to open up over superannuation

image.altText: A man in rescue gear gestures on a rubble-strewn street with a car engulfed in flames to his right

props.synopsis: A government counterinsurgency recaptures several towns that had been overrun in recent days by rebels, the army says, as Russian strikes kill at least 19 people.

title.children: Syrian president vows to 'crush' rebels as Russian air strikes pummel Idlib

image.altText: The exterior of an old wooden hut surrounded by bush.

props.synopsis: Halls Hut is about as isolated as you can get in Australia's wilderness. A heli-tourism proponent will seek federal approval to fix it up, but is facing extensive opposition from bushwalkers, fly-fishers and environmental groups over the use of a helicopter.

title.children: It's a hut, on an island, in a lake, in the wilderness. Its upkeep has now become a political issue

image.altText: Albanese sits at the centre table in parliament, frowning as he looks up from paperwork

props.synopsis: In an ominous sign for the government, new research shows dissatisfaction with the direction of the country is at the same level as it was just before the Morrison government lost the election.

title.children: A freight train of voter anger might be about to hit Albanese

image.altText: Giant screen on the wall of the ASX, with large green numbers, showing the price of shares which have risen.

props.synopsis: The ASX nudged 0.1 per cent higher after another record close on Wall Street, but the markets will be watching this morning's releases of key retail and building data. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX edges higher after Wall Street rally rolls on, gold sector heats up with $5 billion takeover

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX nudges higher, De Grey Mining soars on takeover
Northern Star Resources snaps up rival gold miner De Grey Mining in a $5 billion deal
Meta introduces new rules to crack down on financial scammers

image.altText: An Indian/South Asian man with black facial hair speaks onstage wearing a light suit jacket with American flags behind him

props.synopsis: The incoming president has picked a long-term ally who has previously pledged to "shut down" the US federal intelligence agency.

title.children: Trump singles out loyalist Kash Patel to lead FBI

image.altText: A photo of residential apartments. One of them has been completely flattened by air strikes.

props.synopsis: Iran has reportedly promised to pay for the reconstruction, but unlike in 2006, Arab states have not committed funding.

title.children: Lebanese return to scenes of destruction in Beirut's suburbs as damage bill exceeds $5 billion

image.altText: A screenshot of the face of a man in a video.

props.synopsis: Hamas has released a video of an Israeli-American hostage in which he pleads for US President-elect Donald Trump to secure his release.

title.children: UN halts aid to Gaza after violence as hostage video released by Hamas

image.altText: A young white boy with red hair sitting in a wheelchair smiling at an adult. They're in a school classroom

props.synopsis: Families and schools say it's more than possible to set children with disability up for success with their education. These are some of their best tips.

title.children: Whether you're a parent or educator, here's how you can set children with disability up for success at school

image.altText: A photo of protesters outside UN talks on curbing plastic pollution. One of them holds a sign saying 'less plastics, more life'.

props.synopsis: Countries remain divided on the issue, with more than 100 nations wanting to cap plastic production, while a handful of oil-producers are only prepared to target plastic waste.

title.children: UN talks on curbing plastic pollution collapse after oil states block production limits

image.altText: Two dark haired women stand outside on a sunny street each holding a small, dark haired fluffy dog smiling

props.synopsis: A WA family says it was the support of their community that got them through the "devastating moment" of losing everything in a house fire.

title.children: Family whose home burnt down while they were on holiday reunited with lost pet dog

image.altText: A woman looks away.

props.synopsis: New legislation gives Belgian sex workers the right to refuse clients, access unemployment support and mandates sweeping safety protocols for employers.

title.children: Sex workers in Belgium receive fundamental labour rights in world-first 'revolution'

image.altText: A police car outside a house.

props.synopsis: Police say a man and a woman were shot dead at Rye, on Victoria's Mornington Peninsula early this morning. Detectives believe another man fled the scene.

title.children: Manhunt underway after two people were shot dead on Victoria's Mornington Peninsula

image.altText: Ambulance rushing along a road with lights on

props.synopsis: The child was taken to hospital with significant cuts to the chest and shoulder after he was attacked by an older border collie at a Townsville home.

title.children: 5yo boy suffers serious injuries after being attacked by border collie in north Queensland

image.altText: dead fish carcasess on the edge of a river

props.synopsis: A report finds the Murray-Darling Basin "continues to decline" and the multi-billion-dollar plan to try to save it has not improved its health.

title.children: Despite a $13b government investment, study finds health of Australia's largest river system has declined

image.altText: Man carries a child who is holding an umbrella on his back as he wades through flood waters in Thailand.

props.synopsis: At least 12 people have been killed and hundreds of thousands affected in Malaysia and Thailand as officials brace for the worst flood in a decade.

title.children: Death toll rises to 12 as Thailand and Malaysia face worst floods in decades

image.altText: Workers in high vis vests carrying signs.

props.synopsis: Around 200 Woolworths workers are picketing a distribution centre in Melbourne's south-east which the supermarket giant is trying to reopen to ease a shortage of some items at its stores.

title.children: Union pickets Woolworths distribution centre amid dispute causing supermarket supply shortages

image.altText: Three different petrol station signs with prices on the board

props.synopsis: When it's time to fill up with petrol, paying extra at the pump can be financially costly. We've done the legwork for you and dispelled the myths about what controls prices and how they're determined.

title.children: Cheap Tuesdays are a 'thing of the past' but shopping around can help motorists save at the petrol pump

image.altText: A Nelson Alexander office

props.synopsis: Nelson Alexander says information related to 89 historical tenancies was allegedly stolen from its office in the city's inner-north last month.

title.children: Names, numbers, identity documents feared stolen from Melbourne real estate agency

image.altText: The sun beams through buildings on Adelaide's Hindley Street.

props.synopsis: With parts of the country already sweltering though heatwaves, support services are worried many people will not be able to afford to keep cool this year.

title.children: Above average summer temperatures prompt concerns more Australians at risk of heat-related injuries

image.altText: A man climbs an icy mountainside using axe-like tools.

props.synopsis: When ABC News reporter James Tugwell first pitched a story about the little-known but rapidly growing adventure sport of ice climbing in Australia, he didn't quite know what he was getting himself into.

title.children: The challenges of filming ice climbing for ABC News

image.altText: Australian women's rugby 7s player Maddison Levi strides away down the field for a try with two players chasing her.

props.synopsis: Maddison Levi delivers an amazing display, scoring a record 15 tries over the weekend as Australia's rugby women wins a fifth-straight Dubai Sevens crown.

title.children: Maddison Levi powers Aussie women to sevens glory

image.altText: A Fiorentina soccer player lies on the ground in a Serie A game in Italy as his teammates and opponents call for help.

props.synopsis: Distressing scenes in Italian football as Fiorentina midfielder Edoardo Bove collapses on-field against Inter Milan, with the player taken to hospital and placed in an induced coma.

title.children: Italian footballer Edoardo Bove in induced coma after collapsing during Serie A clash against Inter Milan

image.altText: A fisherman holding a big fish on a boat.

props.synopsis: Catching a barramundi measuring more than 1 metre is considered the holy grail of fishing, but anglers targeting trophy fish in one of Australia's biggest river catchments are blowing this out of the water.

title.children: Big barra bounty hunter captures monster fish 13 years after it was first tagged by a mate

image.altText: a blue eureka flag with a white cross and southern cross flies above a red brick building at dusk

props.synopsis: As the 170th anniversary of the Eureka Rebellion rolls around, experts say the true story of the event — and its iconic Southern Cross flag — need to be remembered.

title.children: The Eureka Stockade and its flag are often misunderstood and misappropriated. The real story is one of unity

image.altText: A man wearing a flower ring on the neck.

props.synopsis: Taiwan's President Lai Ching-te stops over at Hawaii and Guam as part of a week-long trip in the South Pacific, as Beijing warns the United States to handle the Taiwan issue with "utmost caution".

title.children: Taiwan president kicks off Pacific tour with US stops, drawing anger from Beijing

image.altText: Red firecrackers go off in front of police guards.

props.synopsis: A fourth day of protests in the former Soviet republic sees thousands of protesters calling for EU membership talks to continue.

title.children: Water cannons and fireworks as Georgians protest disputed anti-EU election results
